snippet: The flutist Dave Valentin used to play around the world, but since 2012 he has been recovering from a stroke, without savings or health insurance.
abstract: Autographed posters and concert photos in Dave Valentin’s Bronx living room attest to his status as one of the pre-eminent flutists in Latin jazz; now, he is mostly alone in his home following a stroke in 2012 that left him paralyzed on his right side; though he has recovered about 85 percent of his abilities, he spends his days quietly in a rented bungalow in Harding Park near the East River.
lead_paragraph: The flutist Dave Valentin used to play around the world, but since 2012 he has been recovering from a stroke, without savings or health insurance.

headline.main: Latin Jazz Stalwart Struggles to Make Sweet Sounds Again
headline.print_headline: Latin Jazz Stalwart Struggles to Make Sweet Sounds Again
